00032 #include <fcntl.h>
00033 
00034 #include <netinet/in.h>
00035 
00036 /* local defines. */
00037 #define MAX_LINE (1024 * 1024)  /* 1Mbyte. */
00038 
00039 /* my includes. */
00040 #include "program_typedefs.h"
00041 
00042 /* function prototypes. */
00043 void log_report_exit (cint, unique, unique, cint, bool);
00044 static char *get_timestamp (void);
00045 void log_report (cint, unique, unique);
00046 bool log_ip_timestamp (unique, unique);
00047 
00048 /* functions. */
00049 /* the following function uses the syslog
00050    facility to report a message and then
00051    terminates the program `exit' call. */
00052 void
00053 log_report_exit (cint p, unique msg, unique file, cint e, bool eb)
00054 {
00055   /* is there any file for the report? */
00056   if (file != NULL)
00057     syslog (p, "%s error for `%s': %s.", msg, file, strerror (errno));
00058   else
00059     syslog (p, "%s error: %s.", msg, strerror (errno));
00060 
00061   /* do you want to exit the program? */
00062   if (eb)
00063     exit (e);
00064 }
00065 
00066 /* the following function is exactly the same as
00067    `log_report_exit'. however, does not terminate
00068    the program. */
00069 void
00070 log_report (cint p, unique msg, unique file)
00071 {
00072   /* is there any file for the report? */
00073   if (file != NULL)
00074     syslog (p, "%s error for `%s': %s.", msg, file, strerror (errno));
00075   else
00076     syslog (p, "%s error: %s.", msg, strerror (errno));
00077 }
00078 
00079 /* the following function returns a character
00080    string representing the current date, time. */
00081 static char *
00082 get_timestamp (void)
00083 {
00084   time_t now = time (NULL);
00085   return asctime (localtime (&now));
00086 }
00087 
00088 /* the following function writes an ip timestamp. */
00089 bool
00090 log_ip_timestamp (unique file, unique message)
00091 {
00092   /* extern necessary elements. */
00093   extern int fsync (int);
00094 
00095   /* the timestamp/ip entry. */
00096   char log_entry[MAX_LINE];
00097 
00098   /* open the `file' for writing. if it exists,
00099      append to it: otherwise, create a new file. */
00100   int fd = open (file, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_APPEND, 0660);
00101 
00102   /* does the `file' opened / created? */
00103   if (fd < 0)
00104     {
00105       log_report (LOG_ERR, "open() [timestamp]", file);
00106       return false;
00107     }
00108 
00109   sprintf (log_entry, "* connection accepted from: `%s'. timestamp: %s",
00110            message, get_timestamp ());
00111 
00112   if (write (fd, log_entry, strlen (log_entry)) < 0)
00113     {
00114       log_report (LOG_ERR, "write() [timestamp]", file);
00115       close (fd);
00116       return false;
00117     }
00118 
00119   /* write data, close file. */
00120   fsync (fd);
00121   close (fd);
00122 
00123   return true;
00124 }
